headline: How the Narrative Around PG&E Is Shifting After New Wildfire and Grid Developments
summary: The consensus analyst price target for PG&E has ticked up from $20.39 to $20.69, reflecting a subtle shift in sentiment among market watchers. Analysts cite the company’s recent legislative wins and progress on risk mitigation as reasons for renewed optimism. However, some remain cautious due to lingering regulatory and operational concerns. Stay tuned to discover how you can stay ahead of evolving insights on PG&E’s outlook as the narrative develops. What Wall Street Has Been Saying Analyst...

headline: BMO Capital Raises PG&E Corporation (PCG) PT to $25, Cites Discounted Valuation, Potential Catalysts
summary: PG&E Corporation (NYSE:PCG) is one of the best high volume stocks to buy according to Wall Street analysts. On October 9, BMO Capital analyst James Thalacker maintained his bullish stance on the company while giving a Buy rating to the company’s shares. Later on October 14, the firm raised the price target on PG&E Corporation […]
